tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: But, Satan misled people to believe that the angels had a distinct identity of their own and that they could be the source of bringing blessings in this world and salvation in the Hereafter
distractors: This verse explains the rules of inheritance

This verse describes the characteristics of believers

tafsirQuiz.question: What key concept does this verse highlight?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: When the Creator and Organiser of all these things is the One God, then how could it be reasonable for people to worship any entity other than Him. Man is in need of innumerable things to sustain his life, for example, light, water, air, food, minerals, etc
distractors: This verse promises paradise to the righteous
This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
This verse gives rulings on trade and commerce

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: That day is bound to come when a distinction will be drawn between the true and the false; righteous people will be rewarded for their virtue and wrongdoers will be punished for their evil deeds

This verse discusses the creation of the universe

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Almighty God has blessed every man with the capability to think and distinguish between truth and untruth. One who utilizes this innate talent, receives proper guidance and one who does not is left to go astray

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Fatir, Ayah 9?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The present world gives us an introduction to the Hereafter. This process of rain-making proves that the Organizer of the universe has full powers over it

tafsirQuiz.question: What deeper meaning is explained in this verse?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: God first created man from the elements of the earth. This shows that the Creator of the child knew his requirements beforehand, otherwise how could He have made such perfect arrangements in advance

tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: As a reward for their sacrifice God admitted them in the everlasting gardens of paradise where no sorrow or trouble could ever affect them. From Jacob up to the time of Jesus, all the prophets were from among the tribes of the Children of Israel

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Those who deny the Truth in this world will admit the Truth in the Hereafter. But this will be of no avail, because in the Hereafter, such an admission will be made under compulsion, whereas God seeks voluntary submission from man

tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Such possibilities indicate that the Creator of this universe is a Being who knows the unknown and is aware of the secrets hidden in one’s heart. Man therefore, is accountable before the all-knowing and all-powerful God from whom no offence remains concealed

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The creation of the universe, with its unlimited space and the innumerable astronomical bodies suspended in it, is an awe-inspiring phenomenon. Such colossal creation—an unimaginally gigantic feat—cannot be wholly or even partially attributed to any of the beings whom people worship as deities

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: In this world, every man presents himself as a protagonist of Truth. He forgets that although he has the option to reject the Truth, he has no power to save himself from the result of doing so

tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Man has been given freedom of action in the world, but he misuses it. His wrongs are so many that if he were caught hold of immediately for his wrongdoings, the entire human race would be wiped out from the world
